qas.question: Who captured him during World War I?
Tito joined which unit in Omsk?
What party in Yugoslavia did he join?

context: Josip Broz was born to a <a1_0>Croat<a1_0/> father and <a0_0>Slovene<a0_0/> mother in the village of Kumrovec, Croatia. Drafted into military service, he distinguished himself, becoming the youngest Sergeant Major in the Austro-Hungarian Army of that time. After being seriously wounded and captured by <a2_0>the Imperial Russians<a2_0/> during World War I, Josip was sent to a work camp in the Ural Mountains. He participated in the October Revolution, and later joined a <a3_0>Red Guard<a3_0/> unit in Omsk. Upon his return home, Broz found himself in the newly established Kingdom of Yugoslavia, where he joined the <a4_0>Communist Party<a4_0/> of Yugoslavia (KPJ).
